title: Houston's only outdoor roller rink reopens at Discovery Green
description: Houston's only outdoor roller rink, The Rink at Discovery Green, will reopen on Feb. 9 with a party featuring skate instructors, lessons and music by DJ Yung Chris.

title: ‘Shit politics’ – Starmer allies urge him to get party ready for government
description: Business leaders sympathetic to Labour are pushing for a change to the party’s investment rules which would make it easier to spend money on projects which will boost long-term growth without breaking the Treasury’s fiscal rules.

title: Ed Miliband ‘on borrowed time’ after Labour’s £28bn green pledge climbdown
description: Shadow climate secretary angers backbenchers and activists by backing Sir Keir Starmer’s climbdown on flagship policy

title: Ed Miliband: I didn't think of quitting over Labour's green U-turn
description: Ed Miliband has insisted he did not consider quitting over Labour's decision to junk its pledge to spend £28bn a year on green projects. Labour's shadow net zero secretary, a key backer of the policy, said the party's plans still met his criteria of "moving the dial" on climate change.

title: Ed Miliband insists he DIDN'T consider quitting over Labour's green U-turn after Keir Starmer and Rachel Reeves junk £28bn spending plans to plunge party into chaos
description: Ed Miliband tonight insisted he didn't consider quitting over Labour's green U-turn after the party junked its £28billion a year spending plans. The shadow climate secretary was thought to be on resignation watch as Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer and ...

title: Starmer pledges West Midlands gigafactory
description: Sir Keir Starmer said Labour would build a gigafactory in the West Midlands, if the party wins the next general election. Speaking on a visit to Coventry a day after insisting he had no choice but to ditch Labour's £28bn-a-year green investment pledge, he said one of eight new gigafactories in his scaled back proposals would be in the region.

title: Scottish BudgetLocal authorities call for ‘flexibility’ to hike council tax by up to 5 per cent
description: Local authorities in Scotland have asked for the flexibility to hike council tax by up to 5 per cent while still receiving cash intended to fund a freeze. Council leaders have demanded an urgent meeting with Shona Robison, the deputy first minister and finance secretary, amid a growing row over the issue.

title: Former Green deputy leader wins discrimination case over his gender-critical beliefs
description: THE Green Party lost a legal battle against its former deputy leader today over its discrimination against his gender-critical beliefs. Dr Shahrar Ali launched the action against the party, the first of its kind, after being forced out of his role as policing and domestic safety spokesman in February 2022.

title: Rachel Reeves won Shadow Cabinet ‘war’ on £28bn U-turn, insiders say
description: Shadow Chancellor Rachel Reeves won an internal battle at the top of Labour that resulted in Sir Keir Starmer deciding to U-turn on a pledge to spend £28bn on green investment.

title: Pressure growing on Sir Keir to scrap two-child limit under Labour government
description: PRESSURE is growing on Sir Keir Starmer to commit to scrapping the two-child limit under a Labour government amid ongoing criticism of its recent green pledge U-turn.

title: Keir Starmer visits Coventry as Labour say they're 'still committed' to funding gigafactory in the West Midlands
description: The West Midlands "will get a gigafactory" if Labour wins power, the shadow chancellor has claimed. Funding pledged for the scheme by the party last year has not been hit by it ditching a flagship £28bn-a-year investment target for green projects, Rachel Reeves said today (9 February.)

title: India awards top honour to former prime ministers, green revolution pioneer
description: THE decision to award India’s Bharat Ratna to former prime ministers P V Narasimha Rao and Charan Singh and green revolution pioneer M S Swaminathan has taken

title: Keir Starmer's £4.7 billion pledge 'matches what Scotland spends alone'

title: After the great U-turn, what exactly is Labour’s green policy now?
description: Keir Starmer has dropped a £28bn pledge that no one really understood. So, asks John Rentoul, is the party’s net zero plan any clearer?

title: John Glen MP: 'I have done my best and will continue to do so'
description: Mr Glen, who has been Salisbury's MP for nearly 14 years, said: "I think I have a deep understanding of Salisbury and the surrounding area, its people and the opportunities and challenges that are ongoing.

title: What your choice of crisps says about you
description: If these are served at a party, small-talk is unnecessary ... arguing over the relative merits and demerits of Sir Keir Starmer ditching Labour’s £28bn green pledge over pudding. It’ll only end when someone accidentally knocks over the Perelló ...

title: Starmer: Ditching green spending pledge was about ‘being straight’ with voters
description: Environmental groups, trade union allies and energy industry figures have all expressed disappointment at the U-turn.

title: Ed Miliband says he never considered quitting over axed £28bn green pledge
description: Ed Miliband has insisted he did not consider resigning over Labour’s junking of its pledge to spend £28 billion a year on green projects. The shadow climate secretary, seen as a key proponent of the policy, said the party’s plans still meet his criteria of moving the dial on climate.

title: What will a Labour government mean for food and farming?
description: With the general election drawing near, there's a blossoming romance between Labour and big business. But where does it stand on the crucial issues affecting food retail and farming?

title: Keir Starmer told ‘no Labour seat is safe’ as Tories make gain in council by-election
description: The loss comes as Labour U-turns on an election pledge to spend £28 billion a year as part of the party's Green Prosperity Plan.

title: Oil and gas companies lash out at Labour’s new windfall tax plans
description: To help pay for its new pledge of a £23.7 billion uplift in green spending over five years, the party said it would increase the rate of the government’s existing windfall tax from 75 to 78 percent and would extend the levy by a year, to 2029.

title: Sweden Democrats threaten to quit right-wing EU group if Orbán joins

title: Kemi Badenoch says death threats have ‘intensified’ since publication of Nadine Dorries book – as it happened
description: Keir Starmer said he believes the British public “appreciate” Labour being “straight” about its plans for the economy, after the party announced a major U-turn on its green spending pledge. Rishi Sunak again refused to apologise for his transgender ...

title: Campaigners say 'urgent action' needed over British Gas, EDF, OVO, Octopus bills
description: Campaigners have called for "urgent action" over rising British Gas, OVO, EDF, Octopus energy bills after a Labour Party U-turn as millions risk poverty ... Labour has cut its green investment plans by half, ending weeks of speculation.

title: Tory MP Laura Trott skewered over party's U-turns in excruciating 60-second take down
